message: I realized just yesterday another reason to not elide the keywords: the exception stack trace. Async stack traces are already pretty difficult to read as it is, with a lot of noise from "System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter" and generated names from rewritten async methods, but when you elide async/await in an intermediate method, this method doesn't appear in the stack at all! This makes it pretty hard to make sense of logged exceptions.
